newsitem.title: UK: Britain condemns Sierra Leone coup.
newsitem.headline: Britain condemns Sierra Leone coup.

text.p: Britain on Tuesday issued a strong condemnation of this weekend's military coup in the West African state of Sierra Leone.

The Foreign Office joined the United Nations, the Organisation of African Unity, South Africa, France and Germany in condemning the junior officers' coup led by Major Johnny Paul Koromah wich ended a year of civilian rule.
"We deplore this attempt to overthrow the elected government of Sierra Leone and strongly urge the restoration of democratic civilian government," a Foreign Office statement said.
"We have made clear to the military leaders in Sierra Leone our serious concern over the level of violence against both local and foreign communities."
Shops and businesses in the capital Freetown were looted after the coup and residents on Monday ignored orders to return to work amid speculation that there could be a counter-coup.
There are about 800 British nationals living in Sierra Leone, some of whom have been the victims of looting. They have been urged by the Foreign Office to remain in their homes.
